block.p: Melissa Christina McCann, a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. William P. McCann of Andover, Mass., was married yesterday to Robert Anthony Santangelo, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel P. Santangelo of Garden City, N.Y. The Rev. Fritz Cerullo performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Cecilia in Boston.
The bride graduated summa cum laude from Georgetown University, and the bridegroom magna cum laude from Duke University. They received law degrees from Harvard, where they met.

Melissa Christina McCann, a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. William P. McCann of Andover, Mass., was married yesterday to Robert Anthony Santangelo, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel P. Santangelo of Garden City, N.Y. The Rev. Fritz Cerullo performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Cecilia in Boston.
The bride graduated summa cum laude from Georgetown University, and the bridegroom magna cum laude from Duke University. They received law degrees from Harvard, where they met.

Ms. McCann, 31, is keeping her name. She is a tax lawyer at Viacom in Manhattan and the primary adviser on tax issues for productions at two subsidiaries, Paramount Pictures and CBS Broadcasting. Her father, a neurosurgeon, is a partner in New England Neurological Associates, a practice in North Andover, Mass. Her mother, Jill McCann, is a broker at Coldwell Banker Hunneman Victor, a real estate agency in Andover.

Mr. Santangelo, 30, is a vice president and investment banker for software companies at Wit SoundView, a Manhattan investment banking concern. His mother, Toni Santangelo, teaches the fifth grade at Our Lady of Perpetual Health School in South Ozone Park, Queens. His father retired as the director of security for properties owned by Corporate Property Investors, which was in Manhattan; he is now a security consultant in Garden City.
